article:
The 'Human Genome Organisation' ('HUGO') is an organization involved in the
Human Genome Project, a project about mapping the human genome. HUGO was
established in 1989 as an international organization, primarily to foster
collaboration between genome scientists around the world. The HUGO Gene
Nomenclature Committee (HGNC), sometimes referred to as "HUGO", is one of HUGO's
most active committees and aims to assign a unique gene name and symbol to each
human gene.
